alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued April 11 at 4:20AM EDT until April 13 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, significant coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Coastal Volusia County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning and High Surf Advisory, until 4 AM EDT Wednesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Coastal roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses and some critical infrastructure will be inundated. Significant shoreline erosion will occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The high tide of greatest concern will occur around 1 AM Wednesday. The Volusia county coast remains especially vulnerable to wave runup given the loss of dunes and sea walls as a result of Hurricanes Ian and Nicole last autumn.
info.instruction: Coastal flooding is occurring or imminent. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. High surf will affect the beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. Swimmers should remain out of the water due to large breaking waves and dangerous surf conditions. Entering the surf is not advised.
